question: [File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Value Fields] [Index Bounds Overflow] Can index values exceed the actual number of events in a transaction, causing out-of-bounds access when retrieving events via EventSchema? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Value Fields] [Version Zero Attack] Can events at version 0 (genesis) be manipulated or overwritten to corrupt initial chain state and break bootstrap verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Value Fields] [Negative Index] Although index is u64, can negative offsets in calling code be cast to large u64 values causing incorrect event retrieval? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Value Fields] [Version Compression Attack] Can very large version numbers (near u64::MAX) cause encoding to fail or produce inefficient keys that degrade database performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Integration] [DBIndexer Write Race] When DBIndexer writes to EventByKeySchema at process_a_batch, can race conditions with EventDb.put_events cause duplicate or missing event indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Integration] [V1 vs V2 Event Confusion] Can mixing ContractEvent::V1 and translated V2 events in EventByKeySchema cause sequence number conflicts or index corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Integration] [Skip Index Flag Bypass] When skip_index=true is used in put_events, can this create inconsistencies where EventSchema has events but EventByKeySchema doesn't, breaking lookups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Integration] [Event Translation Exploit] Can malicious V2 events be translated to V1 format with crafted EventKeys that collide with legitimate V1 events, corrupting the index? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Integration] [Batch Write Atomicity] Can batch.put operations for EventByKeySchema fail partially, leaving some events indexed and others not, causing incomplete event streams? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Integration] [EventStore Query Mismatch] Can decode_key/decode_value produce values that don't match what EventStore expects, causing get_event_by_version_and_index to fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [DoS] [Key Space Exhaustion] Can an attacker emit massive numbers of events with unique EventKeys to fill the EventByKeySchema key space and exhaust database storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [DoS] [Deep Sequence Number Attack] Can an attacker create an event stream with extremely high sequence numbers (near u64::MAX) to cause integer overflow in sequence number arithmetic in EventStore queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [DoS] [Encoding CPU Exhaustion] Can repeatedly encoding/decoding malicious EventKeys with complex BCS structures cause CPU exhaustion on indexer nodes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [DoS] [Iterator Amplification] Can crafted event streams cause EventByKeySchema iterators to consume excessive memory or CPU when scanning large sequence number ranges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Error Handling] [BCS Deserialization Panic] Can invalid BCS data in the database cause from_bytes to panic instead of returning an error, crashing the node during event queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Error Handling] [Write Error Propagation] Are write_u64 errors properly propagated to callers, or can they be silently ignored leading to corrupted database entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Error Handling] [Size Check Failure Mode] When ensure_slice_len_eq fails, does it provide enough information to diagnose database corruption, or could it mask underlying issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty Event Stream] Can EventKeys with no events (seq_num never written) cause get_latest_sequence_number to return incorrect results or cause queries to fail? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Edge Case] [Maximum Key Size] Can EventKeys with maximum-size AccountAddress and creation_number values cause encoded keys to exceed database key size limits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Edge Case] [Zero-Length Data] What happens when decode_key or decode_value receive empty byte slices - do they panic, return errors, or produce undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [Write-Write Race] Can concurrent batch.put operations from different threads write conflicting (EventKey, seq_num) entries, causing last-write-wins behavior that loses events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [Read-Write Race] During event indexing, can queries observe partially-written keys or values due to lack of transactional isolation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [Iterator Consistency] Can database mutations during iterator traversal cause iterators to skip events or return duplicate entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [Encoding Thread Safety] Are encode_key/encode_value calls thread-safe when multiple threads encode the same EventKey simultaneously? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_key/mod.rs] [Storage] [Column Family Isolation] Can events written to EVENT_BY_KEY_CF_NAME leak to other column families or be read by unauthorized code paths? (Low)
